judges: Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell dissents and would grant a judgment n.o.v.
Mr. Justice Musmanno dissents and would order a new trial limited to damages alone.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Judgment affirmed on tbe opinion of President Judge Jamieson, as reported in 44 Pa. D. & C. 2d 636.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell dissents and would grant a judgment n.o.v.
Mr. Justice Musmanno dissents and would order a new trial limited to damages alone.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Matthew W. Bulloch, Jr., Second Deputy City Solicitor, with him Franh J. Pfizenmayer, Assistant City Solicitor, and Edward G. Bauer, Jr., City Solicitor, for City of Philadelphia, defendant.
casebody.head_matter:
Massman, Appellant, v. Philadelphia, Appellant.
Argued April 18, 1968.
Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Lawrence J. Richette, for plaintiff.
Matthew W. Bulloch, Jr., Second Deputy City Solicitor, with him Franh J. Pfizenmayer, Assistant City Solicitor, and Edward G. Bauer, Jr., City Solicitor, for City of Philadelphia, defendant.
May 21, 1968:
